1">923504cc47410200e90d87e8dee490e2</std_change_producer_version> <sys_class_name>std_change_proposal</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>beth.anglin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2015-06-29 10:49:13</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>global</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>202340cc47410200e90d87e8dee490fb</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>6</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>Change.Manager</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2015-06-29 10:54:51</sys_updated_on> <task_effective_number>STDCHG0000001</task_effective_number> <template_name>Reboot Windows Server</template_name> <template_value>short_description=Reboot Windows Server^description=Reboot a Windows Server (after patching or to clear a fault) making sure that it is removed from monitoring alerts, that network attached storage is unmounted and that it restarts cleanly^implementation_plan=--In the server monitoring console set the server to "Maintenance mode" to prevent alerts being sent --If the server has network attached storage (NFS or iSCSI) stop any file server applications and unmount the storage --Reboot the server4. Check the Windows system log for any error messages --In the server monitoring console set the server back to "Operational" mode^backout_plan=There is no backout plan for this change template^test_plan=Ensure that the monitoring console is all green for this server before closing change request^EQ^type=standard</template_value> <time_worked/> <universal_request/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </std_change_proposal> </record_update>
